alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Waller; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Colorado, north central Wharton, southeastern Austin and southern Waller Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 859 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Eagle Lake, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sealy, Eagle Lake, San Felipe, Garwood, Nada and Cat Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
